title: Bug 49195: Error message printed when using port 1 as shutdown port with Windows service
description: When using port 1 as the shutdown port with Tomcat installed as a Windows service, an error message is printed in the catalina.20100427.log file. However, this message does not affect the shutdown process as Tomcat stops successfully after printing the message. It is worth noting that when the service launcher stops Tomcat, the Catalina server is not null.
OB:
When using port 1 as the shutdown port with the Tomcat Windows service, the following error message is printed in the catalina.20100427.log file: 

27.04.2010 17:49:13 org.apache.catalina.startup.Catalina stopServer
SEVERE: No shutdown port configured. Server not shut down.

Despite this error message, Tomcat stops successfully after printing the message.
EB: When using port 1 as the shutdown port with the Tomcat Windows service, no error message should be printed in the catalina.20100427.log file. The shutdown process should complete without any errors.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 

1. Install Tomcat as a service on Windows.
2. Start the service.
3. Stop the service.
4. Alternatively, shut down the server through an OS signal or call Catalina.stop().
